Greetings to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian President 
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on July 10 sent a message of greetings to Mongolian President Natsagyn Bagabandi on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of the victory of the Mongolian people's revolution.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will as ever continue to expand and develop in conformity with the mutual interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president and the people of Mongolia new achievements in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe 
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on July 9 sent a message of greetings to Frederique de Menezes, president of the Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of its independence and the proclamation of the republic.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

Solidarity with Struggle for Checking Troop Dispatch to Iraq Called for
articles.content:
Solidarity with Struggle for Checking Troop Dispatch to Iraq Called for 
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification on July 7 issued a statement in support of the struggle of workers for checking troop dispatch to Iraq.
 Recalling that the (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) has been in an unabated struggle for the withdrawal of the decision on troop dispatch to Iraq under the slogan of the struggle against the United States and war since it held the second meeting for an all-out struggle on June 29 , the statement said this struggle is a manifestation of resistance against the U.S. dirty war of aggression and a patriotic action to prevent the recurrence of such tragedy as the murder of Kim Son Il .    
 To struggle against troop dispatch is an issue of protecting the vital rights of the workers and, at the same time, an issue of protecting the nation's right to existence, the statement said, stressing that the youth and students declare they will struggle in firm solidarity with the KCTU in its all-out struggle for checking the troop dispatch to Iraq.

DPRK Military Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Military Delegation Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A DPRK military delegation led by Vice-Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, member of the DPRK National Defense Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, left here Monday to visit the People's Republic of China.
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of the PAF Kim Sang Ik, KPA Colonel General Pak Sung Won, Lieutenant General Han Tong Gun, and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and staff members of the military attaches office of his embassy.

articles.title: Books Donated by Russia
articles.content:
Books Donated by Russia
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Konstantin Borisovich Pulikovski, plenipotentiary representative of the president of the Russian Federation to Far East Federal District, donated books to children in the afflicted area of the accident at Ryongchon Railway Station.
 The books were conveyed to an official concerned by the Russian charge d'affaires in Pyongyang on July 12.
